page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY : WELTON. 1.
page.content:
ROMAN AND SAXON BURIALS AT WELTON. In 1963 when building behind the Council houses in Norbeck Lane took place 13 skeletons wer uncovered. They were believed to be Roman. Later in 1971 13 Saxon graves were disturbed when the foundations were dug for the new Community Home - this was then called Saxon House. Nearby medieval crofts were found. This land had been used for settlement until the 14C. and then was used for pasture land until the discovery.
THE CARRIER'S DOG.
Mr. Baldwin's grandfather operated the Carrier Service from Welton to Lincoln and the surrounding villages. Mr. Baldwin still has the stuffed terrior dog that used to accompany his grandfather on the cart.
